email.heading: SACAs Nominations Open
email.text:
The Student Academic Choice Awards - or SACAs for short - are Imperial College Union's flagship event for empowering students to recognise, reward and celebrate excellence among College staff.
Every student at Imperial will have the chance to recognise the innovation, skill, engagement and energy of the staff that they interact with on a daily basis. This is your chance to say 'Thank You' to the lecturers, supervisors, demonstrators and administrators who have helped you through tough times or gone above and beyond to explain a concept or support your research. If there's anyone who stands out to you, then let them know - by nominating them for a SACA.
Eight awards in total cover all faculties, departments and campuses, as well as all modes of study – undergraduate, taught postgraduate and doctoral research.
The eight Student Academic Choice Awards available are:
- Best Supervision - Best Tutoring - Best Graduate Teaching Assistant - Best Teaching for Undergraduates - Best Support Staff - Best Innovation - Best Feedback - Best Teaching for Postgraduates
Every nominee will receive a famous 'We Think You're Great' SACA mug - and the shortlistees will be invited to the SACAs Ceremony in May 2018.
You can nominate as many people as you would like, across all categories- and if your nominee is shortlisted, you might win a free ticket to the Ceremony!
[Nominate someone now](https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/your-union/student-academic-choice-awards)
email.heading: Felix Seeking Tech Contributors
email.text:
Felix, Imperial's weekly newspaper, is planning to expand its tech section after a successful first term and they figured Computing students might be interested in joining. The tech section covers popular science topics ranging from Formula 1 aerodynamics to gene drives, with the plan this term being to get involved with established electronics giants and review their upcoming gadgets and devices. Of course, the usual op-eds will make their appearance as well.
If this is something that interests you, send an email to tecfelix@imperial.ac.uk
email.heading: BlackRock Technology – Spring Insight Week Opportunity
email.sponsor:
Want to have a career that's exciting, rewarding and full of possibilities?
At BlackRock, we challenge ourselves – and each other – to collectively raise our game. Our people are passionate about what they do and are dedicated to bringing new and innovative approaches to their work.
BlackRock combines the best of being a technology pioneer and financial leader. Over the past 29 years, we've grown from an entrepreneurial startup into the world's largest investment manager by putting technology - and continuous innovation - at the heart of our business.
## The Opportunity
Our Spring Insight Programme offers an immersive experience within the Technology division in our London office. You'll participate in work shadowing, a group project, networking and social events, whilst gaining valuable work experience at a globally recognised brand.
This opportunity is a week-long initiative (taking place 16 – 20 April 2018) for motivated students graduating in 2020.
## Next Steps If you'd like to be considered for this programme, please [apply online](https://blackrock.tal.net/vx/brand-0/candidate/so/pm/1/pl/1/opp/2381-Spring-Insight-Programme-EMEA/en-GB) with your CV by Sunday, 4th February 2018.
**Once you have applied, you will receive a link to complete a short coding assessment – please complete this assessment within 4 days of applying.**
For more information on BlackRock and our Technology, please visit our [Engineering Blog](http://rockthecode.io/).
Ready to make an impact? Start your journey with BlackRock and apply today!
